movies.title: Amour libre
movies.plot: Depiction of four urban youths and their excursion to the countryside.
movies.simplePlot: Depiction of four urban youths and their excursion to the countryside.

biography.bio: Eero Melasniemi was born on October 12, 1942 in Helsinki, Finland as Eero Antero Melasniemi. He is an actor and writer, known for Amour libre (1966), The Brothers (1969) and Asfalttilampaat (1968).
biography.name: Eero Melasniemi

biography.bio: Kristiina Halkola was born on June 3, 1945 in Kuusankoski, Finland as Marja Kristiina Halkola. She is an actress, known for Amour libre (1966), Black on White (1968) and Une jeune fille finlandaise (1967). She is married to Eero Melasniemi. They have three children. She was previously married to Kari Franck.
biography.name: Kristiina Halkola

biography.bio: Pekka Autiovuori was born on March 19, 1946 in Riihimäki, Finland as Pekka Kullervo Autiovuori. He is an actor, known for Joulukuusivarkaat (2009), Amour libre (1966) and Asfalttilampaat (1968). He has been married to Marjukka Halttunen since 1987. He was previously married to Pia Kyllikki Helve and Lena Ingeborg Autiovuori.
biography.name: Pekka Autiovuori

biography.bio: Kirsti Wallasvaara was born on December 23, 1942 in Helsinki, Finland as Kirsti Anneli Wallasvaara. She is an actress and writer, known for The Man Who Couldn't Say No (1975), Amour libre (1966) and Une jeune fille finlandaise (1967).
biography.name: Kirsti Wallasvaara

biography.bio: Jukka Sipilä was born on May 12, 1936 in Kivijärvi, Finland as Jukka Ensio Sipilä. He was an actor and director, known for Kiljusen herrasväen uudet seikkailut (1990), Amour libre (1966) and Aliisa (1970). He was married to Helena Notkonen. He died on August 7, 2004 in Helsinki, Finland.
biography.name: Jukka Sipilä

biography.bio: Anneli Sauli was born on August 6, 1932 in Pyhäjoki, Finland as Anneli Helena Savolainen. She is an actress, known for The Man Without a Past (2002), Heartbeats (2009) and Miriam (1957). She was previously married to Jaakko Pakkasvirta and Åke Lindman.
biography.name: Anneli Sauli

biography.bio: Robert Alfthan is an actor and writer, known for Amour libre (1966), Kevätsadetta (1965) and Naurukierukka (1965).
biography.name: Robert Alfthan

biography.bio: Kari Franck was born on May 22, 1940 in Helsinki, Finland as Kari Juhani Franck. He is an actor and director, known for Kuningas jolla ei ollut sydäntä (1982), Seven Brothers (1979) and Coeur de feu (1980).
biography.name: Kari Franck

biography.bio: Eija Kiuru is an actress, known for Amour libre (1966).
biography.name: Eija Kiuru

biography.bio: Riitta Kiuru is an actress, known for Amour libre (1966).
biography.name: Riitta Kiuru

biography.bio: Alma Manninen is an actress, known for Amour libre (1966).
biography.name: Alma Manninen

biography.bio: Kasperi Manninen is an actor, known for Amour libre (1966).
biography.name: Kasperi Manninen

biography.bio: Pentti Manninen is known for his work on Amour libre (1966) and Vanhempi veli (1981).
biography.name: Pentti Manninen

biography.bio: Mikko Niskanen (1929-1990) was a Finnish film director, writer, producer and actor. He started his directing career in 1962 after studying film making in Moscow. His first feature film The Boys (1962) was a proof of his talent and earned him a Jussi Award for directing. During the next 12 months he also directed movies Sissit (1963) - which he won an Jussi Award for directing also - and Hopeaa rajan takaa (1963). All of these three movies were war-themed. During the next few years he worked for TV, but returned to film industry in 1966 with his film Amour libre (1966). The film became a huge success with 700,000 tickets sold to screenings. The film stays in Finnish film industry as 12th highest grossing Finnish film of the history. It was also sold to several different countries. Niskanen won a Jussi for directing. His next two films Une jeune fille finlandaise (1967) and Asfalttilampaat (1968) weren't so well received, but earned him a Jussi for directing the first one. In early 1970s he directed Song of the Bloodred Flower (1971) which was everything but a success. He made his comeback with Eight Deadly Shots (1972) which was originally produced for TV. 5-hour movie was eventually cut to a little over two hours for a theatrical release. The film earned him two Jussis; one for directing, another one for best leading role. Niskanen never had the same success that he had with Kahdeksan surmanluotia (1972). His other films of 1970s didn't turn to box office hits or award winners. In the 1980s he received his sixth and last Jussi for directing for his film Course forcée (1982). After it, he directed also two films based on popular novels; Life's Hardy Men (1986) and Lumberjacking (1988) before his death in 1990.
biography.name: Mikko Niskanen
